gameDescription: Two intelligent airships, acting as beacons of hope, embark on a humanitarian mission to bring the endangered Pangolins from Africa to a newly built sanctuary in Vietnam. Each decision made by the airship crews affects not only the safety of these vulnerable animals but also the airship's energy consumption, adding a layer of strategic management.

blueTeam.name: Guardian Aspen
blueTeam.description: Specializing in careful handling of delicate cargo and efficient utilization of resources.

redTeam.name: Skyward Warden
redTeam.description: Masters of flight efficiency and experts in weather and route management.

turns.scenario: Both teams have collected the Pangolins and must now decide how to set flight conditions for the sensitive cargo. The choice can either prioritize pangolin comfort or resources conservation.

options.A: Increase cabin pressure and temperature to recreate the pangolins' natural environment.
options.B: Maintain standard flight conditions to save hydrogen.

AA.narrative: Both teams opt for increased cabin pressure and temperature. Pangolins seem comfortable, yet the airships' hydrogen reserves deplete more rapidly.

AB.narrative: Guardian Aspen heightens internal conditions while Skyward Warden conserves resources. Aspen's crew observes a higher comfort level in pangolins, yet Warden holds a fuel advantage.

BA.narrative: Skyward Warden adjusts flight conditions while Guardian Aspen conserves hydrogen. The pangolins aboard Warden are visibly less distressed, giving them a morale boost.

BB.narrative: Both teams maintain standard flight conditions. The pangolins exhibit signs of stress due to alien environment, but the mission stays on schedule with sufficient fuel.

turns.scenario: A massive sandstorm hits the fleet as they cross the Sahara Desert. The two options are either a daring fly-through or a fuel-intensive detour.

options.A: Brave the sandstorm using advanced airship technology.
options.B: Use extra hydrogen to detour the storm.

AA.narrative: Both teams press through the storm, utilizing their advanced technology. They hold their course, but the rough journey stresses the Pangolins.

AB.narrative: Aspen tears through the sandstorm while Warden diverts off-course. The detour keeps Wardenâ€™s precious cargo calm, but at a significant fuel cost.

BA.narrative: Warden plies through the storm while Aspen opts for the detour. Warden's actions save fuel, but at the cost of increased pangolin distress.

BB.narrative: Both teams choose the detour to keep their vulnerable cargo at ease. Their careful strategy results in calm pangolins but dwindling hydrogen resources.

turns.scenario: Upon reaching Vietnam, teams need to navigate strict air traffic regulations. Swift management of fuel and environmental pressure is key to their decisions.

options.A: Increase speed to ensure early arrival and easier navigation through the traffic.
options.B: Maintain current speed and negotiate the traffic in real-time.

AA.narrative: Both airships accelerate. They manage the traffic with ease but at the cost of valuable hydrogen, leading to a critical balance between punctuality and sustainability.

AB.narrative: Aspen speeds up while Warden keeps pace and negotiates traffic. Warden maneuvers skilfully, while Aspen's early arrival stresses the Pangolins due to quick descent.

BA.narrative: Warden pushes ahead while Aspen keeps its consistent speed. Aspen's professional handling of real-time traffic negotiation displays its commitment towards a balanced mission approach.

BB.narrative: Both airships opt for real-time traffic negotiation. Despite the challenging end to their mission, their seamless handling of regulations symbolizes their dedication to a sustainable transportation mission.
